title:
Inquiry on first question several weeks ago.

 I asked if the water authority ever calibrated the meters they use to measure our water consumption. 

All scales and meters on commercial ventures in NC require annual calibrations because they charge for the product either by the gallon or pound.

Does the Water Authority also fall in this catagory? 

And why not?

Can I ask for a meter calibration? and if they overcharge for water, can we sue to get a rebate or reduction in price. 

Thank you,
